result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick C McFarland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--No possession or ingestion of any controlled substances, without a valid Prescription
--The defendant shall not be present at DEB Wholesale Inc.

--The defendant shall not have contact with any known drug offender, except as authorized by DOC
--The defendant shall not hold any employment or engage in volunteer activities where he is responsible to handle money for any organization or person, unless such employment or  volunteer activities are approved in advance by DOC

--Any other assessment, treatment or counseling per agent 
--take prescriptions as prescribed
--maintain Absolute sobriety; no alcohol or illegal drugs
--The defendant shall submit to random drug/alcohol testing at the discretion of DOC
--to submit DNA sample upon demand
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment  per Agent

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 11 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges.
--224 days credit for time already served given

 The Def. is ordered to report and serve the sentence and/or sentence for failure to pay with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of huber/work release without further process.

The Court converts all outstanding costs/fees/surcharges for this case to civil judgment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF258 and 15CF306 called together at 1:42pm [ma]
Defendant Patrick C McFarland in court with Attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes.  ADA Theresa Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court verifies receipt and review of the Criminal Case Settlement and Defense's Sentencing Memorandum
The Court and Counsel discuss the disputed restitution
Atty. Humes provides the Court with a chart that she has prepared with the invoices in dispute and the reason for dispute

As to Case 15CF258: Restitution Hearing conducted, agreed that State has burden of proof

Stacey Heinzelman--sworn and testifies
--direct examination by ADA Beck
--State's Exh. #1(Notification on Insurance Claim from EMC insurance)offered and rec'd
--State's Exh. #2. #3, #4(summaries prepared by Ms. Heinzelman)offered and rec'd
--State's Exh. #5(summary of product taken/billed to customers)offered and rec'd
--State's Exh. #24(Restitution Chart/Invoices in Dispute)
--State's Exh. #20(Invoice #754645)
--State's Exh. #19(Invoice #744503)
--State's Exh. #18(Invoice #763281)
--State's Exh. #17 (Invoice#763704)
--State's Exh. #16(Invoice #764921)
--State's Exh. #15(Invoice #750588)
--State's Exh. #14(Invoice #760041)
--State's Exh. #13(Invoice #762806)
--State's Exh. #12(Invoice #763381)
--State's Exh. #11(Invoice #763916)
--State's Exh. #10(Invoice #764475)
--State's Exh. #9(Invoice #761008)
--State's Exh. #8(Invoice #760861)
--State's Exh. #7(Invoice #762673)
--State's Exh. #6(Invoice #755133)
--State's Exh. #25(Invoice #759230)
--State's Exh. #22(Compilation of Wages)
***Counsel stipulates to amount requested in Exhibit #22; the Court accepts this stipulation
--State's Exh. #21(Compilation of Time Spent in Court)
Exhibits 6 - 20; 21, 22, 24--offered and rec'd

--cross examination by Atty Humes 
--the Court questions Mr. Heinzelman
--re-direct examination by ADA Beck

Thomas Behling--sworn and testifies
--direct examination by ADA Beck
--State's Exh. #23(Compilation of Interest on Personal Loans)offered and rec'd
--cross examination by Atty. Humes 
--Defendant's Exh. #26(CCAP Court Record of Case 15CF258)--the Court takes judicial notice of the exhibit
--re direct examination by ADA Beck 

Evidenced Closed at 3:37pm
The Court and Counsel research Wis. Stat. 973.20

The Court orders restitution to DEB Wholesale in the amount of $65,733.60
The Court orders restitution to Tom Behling in the amount of $1,049.89
The Court orders restitution to Doug and Ella Behling in the amount of $3,052.00
The Court orders restitution to EMC Insurance in the amount of $21,679.28

The Court determines that grand total for restitution to be $91,514.77(to assist in determining the ability to pay)

******************************
Sentencing occurs on Cases 15CF258 and 15CF306:

ADA Beck submits written victim impact statement; the Court questions Mr. Behling
Sentencing arguments given by ADA Beck
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Humes; provides an updated sentencing memorandum

On Case 15CF258, Counts #1, #2, and #6: The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years.

On Case 15CF258, Count #9: The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 5 years.
On Case 15CF306, The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:

--On Count #1 of Case 15CF306:to serve 4 months in the Jefferson County Jail, WITHOUT Huber/ work-release privileges, to commence FORTHWITH

As to Both Cases:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
 per Agent
--No possession or ingestion of any controlled substances, without a valid Prescription
--take prescriptions as prescribed
--Any other assessment, treatment or counseling per agent 
--Attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per agent
--maintain Absolute sobriety; no alcohol or illegal drugs
--The defendant shall submit to random drug/alcohol testing at the discretion of DOC
--The defendant shall not be present at DEB Wholesale Inc.
--The defendant shall not have contact with Thomas Behling, Ella Behling or Douglas Behling, except as/if Behlings and Probation Agent agree
--The defendant shall not have contact with any known drug offender, except as authorized by DOC
--The defendant shall not hold any employment or engage in volunteer activities where he is responsible to handle money for any organization or person, unless such employment or  volunteer activities are approved in advance by DOC
--to pay statutory costs
--to submit DNA sample upon demand 

As to 15CF258 only: 
--to pay restitution to DEB Wholesale in the amount of $65,733.60
--to pay restitution to EMC Insurance Company in the amount of $21,679.28
--to pay restitution to Doug and Ella Behling in the amount of $3,052.00
--to pay retitution to Tom Behling in the amount of $1,049.89 minus $300 which Mr. McFarland provided the clerk today; therefore total to Tom Behling is: $749.89


The Court finds that Mr. McFarland has the ability to pay the amount of restitution over the course of probation

Atty. Humes provides the Clerk with $300 cash; the Court directs that the Clerk of Courts send Tom Behling a check for the $300 and is to be deducted from the total restitution amount of $1049.89(as shown above on conditions of probation)
Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 4:45pm
to cancel 11/10/16 Sentencing/Restitution Hearing in favor of new date after 12/5/16

with attached JI's
Criminal Case Settlement

Defendant Patrick C McFarland in court with Attorney Samantha Jeanne Humes.  Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
(tn)Cases 15CF258 & 15CF306 Called at 1:36 pm 

Court establishes that the intent of the parties is to conduct the plea hearing today with the sentencing & restitution hearing being continued for another date/time. 

Attorney Humes presents basis for the request for a restitution hearing and informs the Court that the defendant is prepared to pay the restituion proposed in the Criminal Case Settlement in the uncharged case 15JE2485.
Court orders restitution in the amount of $350 in the uncharged case to be paid in case15CF258 to Michael Mueller prior to sentencing.

The Court reviews the plea paperwork with the Defendant. Court accepts settlement form submitted by counsel with the exception that parties are fee to argue the amounts due to Deb Wholesale Inc
Factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
 

In case 15CF258  Defendant pleads  NO CONTEST to Counts #1,  #2,  # 6 & #9 
On Motion of the State the Court reads-in and dismisses all remaining counts in case 15CF258 
State moves to read in and dismiss the uncharged case identified as 15JE2485 . Court grants the request. Future prosecution by the State on this offense is barred. 


In case 15CF306 Defendant pleads NO CONTEST to  Count # 1 
On Motion of the State the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2 in case 15CF306


Bond remains in effect
Recess: 2:00 pm
